what: The easiest way to use this theme
title: Using mediocrethemes
text: easiest way use mediocrethemes package set_mediocre_all function. enables set theme color scale graphs document. user can call function beginning document. Subsequent plots can created using standard ggplot commands, additional commands required. user need add + theme_mediocre() + scale_mediocre_d() plots set theme color, called set_mediocre_all() . following example illustrates feature:  function set_mediocre_all takes several arguments: pal, background, second_pair gradient along usual base_size, base_family, base_line_size base_rect_size. following subsections describe use three first arguments.
code: set_mediocre_all() #> Warning: The `size` argument of `element_line()` is deprecated as of ggplot2 3.4.0. #> ℹ Please use the `linewidth` argument instead. #> ℹ The deprecated feature was likely used in the mediocrethemes package. #>   Please report the issue to the authors. #> This warning is displayed once every 8 hours. #> Call `lifecycle::last_lifecycle_warnings()` to see where this warning was #> generated.  ggplot(data = ggplot2::mpg, aes(x = cty, y = displ, fill = manufacturer)) +     geom_col() +     labs(title = "A very nice title", subtitle = "A disappointing subtitle")

title: Using mediocrethemes
text: Available palettes : autumn, rainbow, green, hotcold, blackandwhite, coty, leo, portal, pem. palette defines color theme color scale used graphs, ie color axes text theme colors used legend color scale. change palette “coty” instance, just set argument pal equal “coty” calling function set_mediocre_all beginning document. subsequent graphs created using similar code, difference name palette set_mediocre_all
code: set_mediocre_all(pal = "coty")  ggplot(data = ggplot2::mpg, aes(x = cty, y = displ, fill = manufacturer)) +     geom_col() +     labs(title = "A very nice title", subtitle = "A disappointing subtitle")

title: Using mediocrethemes
text: making maps, one can use function theme_mediocre_map() apply theme consistent main (mediocre) one without unnecessary axis information (text, ticks panel grids). One can remove axis labels command labs(x = NULL, y = NULL).
code: set_mediocre_all()  ggplot2::map_data("state") |>    ggplot() +   geom_polygon(aes(x=long, y=lat, group=group, fill = "A color")) +   theme_mediocre_map() +   coord_map(projection = "mercator") +   labs(     title = "A very nice title",      subtitle = "A disappointing subtitle",     fill = NULL,      x = NULL, y = NULL   )

title: Using mediocrethemes
text: Users can also easily set background plots setting parameter background TRUE. color background predefined fit nicely theme palette. One can course still modify background color adding layer ggplot theme: theme(plot.background = element_rect(fill = "red")).
code: set_mediocre_all(background = TRUE)  ggplot(data = ggplot2::mpg, aes(x = cty, y = displ)) +     geom_point() +     labs(title = "A very nice title", subtitle = "A disappointing subtitle")

title: Using mediocrethemes
text: Graphs two categories, following one instance, ubiquitous.  project, users may consider different sets pairs. instance, may want separate observations years previous graph later use categories Republicans Democrats. User may want use color pair denote year party. instance may want Republicans coded color year 1999. access second color pair, users can therefore set second_pair parameter set_mediocre_all TRUE keep writing standard ggplot code. Subsequent bi-color graphs use second pair colors, different base one still consistent color scale used.
code: set_mediocre_all()  dat <- ggplot2::mpg |>    dplyr::mutate(year = ifelse(drv == "f", NA, year))  ggplot(data = dat, aes(x = drv)) +     geom_bar(aes(fill = factor(year)), position = "dodge") +     labs(title = "A very nice title", subtitle = "A disappointing subtitle") set_mediocre_all(second_pair = TRUE)  ggplot(data = ggplot2::presidential, aes(x = party)) +   geom_bar(aes(fill = party), position = "dodge") +   labs(title = "A very nice title", subtitle = "A disappointing subtitle")
